metadata.title: CVE-2018-25032 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
zlib before 1.2.12 allows memory corruption when deflating (i.e., whencompressing) if the input has many distant matches.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-25032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32z1 - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4.3+esm1
lib64z1 - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4.3+esm1
libx32z1 - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4.3+esm1
zlib1g - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

rsync - 3.1.1-3ubuntu1.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

klibc-utils - 2.0.4-8ubuntu1.16.04.4+esm2
libklibc - 2.0.4-8ubuntu1.16.04.4+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zlib package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.8.dfsg-2ubuntu4.3+esm1').
rsync package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.1-3ubuntu1.3+esm1').
klibc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.4-8ubuntu1.16.04.4+esm2').
